container.heading: Approved Specialty Fields and Qualifications for Identification as a Specialist

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: These regulations govern the qualifications for identification of a licensed dentist as a specialist by the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners, and the application procedures and fees for the identification.

section.heading: Definition.
section.text: For purposes of this chapter, "Board" means the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners.

section.heading: Designation of Specialties.
section.text: The Board recognizes the following areas of dentistry as specialties:

para.text: Oral surgery, also known as oral and maxillofacial surgery;
Any area of specialty approved by the Commission on Dental Accreditation or its successor organization.

section.heading: Qualifications for Identification.
section.text: A licensed dentist qualifies for identification as specialist by the Board if the dentist:

para.text: Has successfully completed a Board-approved specialty training program in that specialty; or
Before July 1, 1979, reasonably represented to the public that the dentist was a specialist in that specialty while limiting the dentist's practice to the specialty.

section.heading: Application for Identification.
section.text: To apply for identification as a specialist, a licensed dentist shall submit to the Board:

para.text: An application on a form that the Board provides;
A fee as set forth in COMAR 10.44.20; and

Either evidence of having successfully completed a Board-approved specialty training program or a written statement, under oath, that sets forth the basis for the dentist's claim that, before July 1, 1979, the dentist reasonably represented to the public that the dentist was a specialist in that specialty, including in that written statement the:
Dates during which the dentist's practice was limited to that specialty; and
Education and experience on which the claim to be a specialist was based.

section.heading: Roster of Specialists.
section.text: The Board shall maintain a roster of all licensed dentists identified as specialists in each of the specialties recognized by the Board.

section.heading: List of Approved Programs.
section.text: The Board shall maintain a list of all specialty training programs it approves. The list shall be open to the public during the normal business hours of the Board.

para.text: On or after July 1, 1985, a person may not represent to the public that the person is a dentist specializing in any specialty of dentistry or limiting the dentist's practice of dentistry to any specialty of dentistry unless the person is recognized by the Board as a specialist in that specialty.
A person may not represent to the public that the person is a specialist in any area not approved by the Board.

section.heading: Penalties for Violation.
section.text: Violation of these regulations constitutes unprofessional conduct and may result in disciplinary action as set forth in Health Occupations Article, §4-315, Annotated Code of Maryland.
